parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.02</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Changes the center of mass of an object smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero (or using the alternative syntax) means an immediate change. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> myObject [[setCenterOfMass]] [centerOfMass, time] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> myObject: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [centerOfMass, time]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> centerOfMass: [[Array]] - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> time: [[Number]] - transition time, 0 for instant center of mass transfer </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> myObject [[setCenterOfMass]] centerOfMass </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> myObject: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> centerOfMass: [[Array]] - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>myObject [[setCenterOfMass]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[0,-1,0], 0.5];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>myObject [[setCenterOfMass]] [0,-1,0];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getCenterOfMass]], [[setMass]], [[getMass]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 20 Jun, 2014 - 12:50
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]<dd class="note">
(ArmA3 1.22) A quick reference:
{| class="wikitable sortable"

! category
! [[setMass]]
! [[setCenterOfMass]]

|-
| unit
| The larger the mass is, the easier a unit will physically fatigued
| N/A

|-
| aircraft
| The larger the mass is, the more sensitive an aircraft will react to joystick, vice versa.
| Aircraft slant due to center change accordingly, and the position of the camera view will be altered relatively at the same time. (3rd person view)
|-
| vehicle
| The larger the mass is, the slower a vehicle drives (Ships will sink), vice versa. (Land vehicle performs like a bouncing ball while ships accelerated pretty speedy.)

| Vehicle slant due to center change accordingly.

|}
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
